def_en: If you say that two people or things are on a par with each other, you mean that they are equally good or bad, or equally important.
In golf, par is the number of strokes that a good player should take to get the ball into a hole or into all the holes on a particular golf course.

def_cn: 不符合标准的；不如预期的
def_en: If you say that someone or something is below par or under par, you are disappointed in them because they are below the standard you expected.
If you say that someone or something is not up to par, you are disappointed in them because they are below the standard you expected.

def_cn: 不在状态；感觉不如平常好
def_en: If you feel below par or under par, you feel tired and unable to perform as well as you normally do.

def_cn: （不快之事）不出所料，在意料之中
def_en: If you say that something that happens is par for the course, you mean that you are not pleased with it but it is what you expected to happen.
